name: The Palms Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent four days in Miami and we stayed at The Palms. We arrived early and were happy to find out that our room was ready. I booked an ocean front king bed through Orbitz. The weird thing was that when we checked in they wanted to give us a two bed Ocean front. On our reservation it said King bed/ two beds. The person checking us in insisted that it would be a two bed room because we booked through Orbitz and that we could contact them if it was and issue. However he ended up giving us a king bed with a connecting door to another room. Not sure what the deal with this was though. It was a little annoying but I was happy because the room was ready early. The room was a little small. Our room had some water damage and the curtain had a cigarette burn on it. The bathroom was nice and modern and separated from the toilet. Our view was very nice. The beach was great and there were plenty of umbrellas available on the two days were were able to lay out. It rained the other two. One thing that I was not aware of but that I now see is on their website is the $14 daily charge. This is for wireless access,Gym access and beach chairs, local dialing and toll-free calls, Newspaper daily (I copied and pasted this right from their site). The internet access sucked. It came and went very frequently.
reviews.title: Miami Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is far from everything. The closest things to it are Subways, small liquor store and and awesome Spanish restaurant called Tropical Beach Cafe. These are all a block away. We walked to Lincoln a couple of times and it was about 15 long blocks. So all in all we had a good time because we love Miami. The hotel was nice minus the $14 fee and distance. Also parking is $29/night. The staff is very cordial. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed every bit of my stay here. Very modern and upbeat decor in the rooms and lobby was contemporary. The room was pretty neat and beds were extremely comfortable. The glass back splash in the bath room was very stylishly. I was pleasantly surprised when I saw Aveda products in the bath room and learned that they had an Aveda spa inhouse. The private beach was beautiful, clean and not at all crowded. We caught glimpse of an American wedding on the beach during our stay. The only minus was a valet parking of $30 but considering the fact that you need to shell out $30 to park on south beach on friday night, I don't mind being charged for valet!
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always appreciate great customer service and as we were met at our car the Staff was immediately responsive to all of our needs. The staff from checkin to the bar and pool were amazing throughout our entire weekend stay. I must admit we truly felt special to the point the Bellman remembered our last name and greated us the next day. Please dont change your Staff as the Hotel and Staff were truly amazing.
reviews.title: Very romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent 3 nights here after finishing a Mediterrean Cruise and loved it. It doesn't look like much from the front, but than we walked into the lobby and WOW it was beautiful. it is like being at a plantation and we loved sitting outside in the covered patio area. It was very romantic, like being on a second honeymoon. The pool is not huge, but it is a nice pool and the beach area was very enjoyable. We arrived right after isaac and had the best weather, clear and sunny. Our rate included the breakfast buffet which was amazing and $50 towards dinner at Essensia which was very nice. The service at both was excellent. The cons; Their drink prices were outrageously expensive. We paid $40 for two mediocre martinis. Also one day we were out of our room early and came back late afternoon and our room had not been serviced. Even with that, we can't wait to stay there again.
reviews.title: Good facility horrible guest service

reviews.text: I am a wedding photographer in Austin, Texas. When our daughter said she wanted to get married at The Palms Hotel & Spa in Miami, I knew they would have a lot to live up to. I can tell you that Monica and staff were amazing in every detail. Nothing was over looked and we felt very welcome. Every thing with the wedding was on time and perfect. The following reception was perfect. Food, staff, bartender and management were all there. A very big thank you from someone who has been to 225 weddings in the last three years and know when things are well run and when they are not..If you have any doubts about The Palm, forget about it. They are THE BEST!!!
reviews.title: Incredible Wedding at The Palms!!!!

reviews.text: The first impression when I walked into this hotel was WOW! I loved the originality of the hotel and how even though it looked in tip top shape it still had an antique feel to it.
reviews.title: Interesting Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, I do have to say that the best part of this hotel was the staff (specially the bellmen) they were always so helpful and never lost that smile on there face. Our room was ready earlier than we expected so that was a great bonus considering that the weather thanks to Issac was bad, so we really didn't want to go outside.
reviews.title: Nine days and nights in Miami Beach
Spa review
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and seemed as if they were recently renovated. The only thing I do have to mention is the bathroom layout which wasn't a problem at all to us, but might be an issue to others. The. Athroom is not your regular shower, toilet and sink all in one room. These rooms have two separate rooms, one has a sink and the shower and the other has a sink and a toilet. Both rooms are in really nice and recently renovated, so it really isn't an issue at all, just a different layout which we actually enjoyed.

Due to Issac we didn't use the pool area, so all I can say is it looked really e from our room window. We did use the hotel restaurant "Escencia" for breakfast. It was pricey but good. They have a breakfast buffet and an omelet station.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: I will start by saying that I was in town for business and not the beach. I like this place, but I wanted to love this place. Their Staff is very good and friendly. I will say this though. I more or less live in different hotels. This staff is definitely trained to accommodate European and Latin American clientele instead of North American customers. I can see how there maybe some complaints to this affect.
reviews.title: Nice Place, Nice Location, Too many hidden Charges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rooms although a bit on the small side are fine. Actually when there is such a good view I paid little attention to the view. I wish the window opened as I hate AC evening on hot nights. The bedding was good quality.
reviews.title: Great weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach is Great. It is aways good when you sit on the beach and take your business calls with a mojito in your hand.
reviews.title: One night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Downside: There 3 problems.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Hotel reception. My company was to pay for the room. When it was time to check out I found that they charged my card with the entire stay. After going back and forth reception they told me that they could not charge my companies card without it being present. Really, after speaking to two different mangers on duty and making huge show. They finally found a credit card authorization form for such purposes. This took more than 2 hours. Although I did not have to pay for it, I thought the Resort Fee was highway robbery. This should be spelled out. If I was on a budget I would freak out.
reviews.title: You can do better!!

reviews.text: This hotel is situated a little north of the South Beach party scene, which in my opinion makes it a quiet getaway. I'm not sure what the age of the hotel is but it has been renovated beautifully. The bar and patio area is the perfect place to relax with a mojito (much better when you ask for it extra sweet) and the rooms are very comfortable. Interesting toilets with a sink on top to wash your hands. There was some construction happening at the beach so I chose spend time at the pool instead. Other than some overly cheeky birds the pool it was lovely.
reviews.title: Relaxed glamour in Miami beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at The Palms so much that we never left the resort all weekend. All staff members were friendly and competent. The food was so good--everything from the burgers by the pool to the fine dining experience at Essencia was wonderful. Yes, it is pricey but then again, so is everything in South Beach.
reviews.title: Amazing food, Aveda Spa and Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were super clean and comfortable and having Aveda toiletries in the room was a real plus. The entire property is gorgeous and I cannot say enough nice things about the waitstaff, both in the restaurant and running food and drink on the beach.
reviews.title: A perfect vacation!

reviews.text: I have never felt so welcome at a hotel before! We spent five nights at The Palms Hotel & Spa, and we would recommend this hotel to our friends and families. We found Andrea in housekeeping to be extremely friendly and helpful. She spoke very good English. Our room was clean and spacious and the bed was comfortable. We were Very, Very happy with the room, and we also received assistance from the stuff, they advice us on where to go on our days out. The location was great, close to the Promenade but tucked away from its hustle and bustle. Two bonuses to the location are that it's walking distance to everything!! And taking the buses is easy. The bus stop is right in front the hotel and they pass by every 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Much less than expected.

reviews.text: All in all it was this was a perfect vacation. We went away for five days without the two kids and these guys made us feel like we had a great short break!!!!
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel in South Beach!!!

description: Let us welcome you with genuine service and laid-back sophistication at our serene oceanfront resort, set in the heart of Miami Beach. Soul-reviving AVEDA spa experiences, natural gourmet cuisine at Essensia and newly renovated rooms, all inspired by the beautiful nature surrounding our sanctuary. Discover Miami Beach’s award-winning independent beach resort.
